page.title: 09MEDIA IN ABERNYTE
page.content: 95% of people buy "The Courier" and "The Sunday Post",which are printed by D.C.Thomsons Dundee and are delivered daily in a British Leyland Van,between 04.00 and 09.00.The paperman delivers the papers to the Village or leaves them at farm road ends.Other people get a paper at their work or at the V.G Shop.These papers are brought by the Baker,when he delivers the bread. The cost of "The Courier"is 16p, "The Sunday Post"is 18p, "The Scotsman" is 22p.There is no charge for delivery. The local School produce an annual village newspaper.BBC Television News at 18.00 is the most popular of the 4 T.V. Channels.The oldest and best way news travels is by people, Telephone,The Postie,The Van,The Shop, Milk Tanker Man,Farmworkers, and the Children at school all help to keep news alive and enjoy a good gossip.
